WireIt.description: WireIt provide classes to build wirable interfaces
WireIt.name: WireIt

animations-plugin.description: Some utility classes to provide animations in WireIt
animations-plugin.name: animations-plugin

inputex-plugin.description:
Include the form library inputEx + WirableField + FormContainer
WARNING: This file should be placed between "inputEx/field.js" and all other inputEx fields
See the inputEx website for documentation of the fields & forms: http://neyric.github.com/inputex
inputex-plugin.name: inputex-plugin

grouping-plugin.description: Some utility classes to provide grouping in the WiringEditor
grouping-plugin.name: grouping-plugin

composable-plugin.description: Extend the WiringEditor with composable wirings
composable-plugin.name: composable-plugin

layout-plugin.description:
Layout Plugin
TODO: provide an AbstractLayout Class
layout-plugin.name: layout-plugin

WireIt.Container.name: WireIt.Container

params.name: layer
params.description: The WireIt.Layer (or subclass) instance that contains this container

constructors.description: Visual module that contains terminals. The wires are updated when the module is dragged around.

eventRemoveWire.description:
Event that is fired when a wire is removed
You can register this event with myTerminal.eventRemoveWire.subscribe(function(e,params) { var wire=params[0];}, scope);

eventAddWire.description:
Event that is fired when a wire is added
You can register this event with myTerminal.eventAddWire.subscribe(function(e,params) { var wire=params[0];}, scope);

setFocus.description: Adds the class that shows the container as "focused"

onCloseButton.description: Called when the user clicked on the close button

setBody.description: Sets the content of the body element

initTerminals.description: Call the addTerminal method for each terminal configuration.

render.description: Render the dom of the container

params.name: event
params.description: The eventRemoveWire event fired by the terminal

params.name: args
params.description: This array contains a single element args[0] which is the removed Wire instance

onRemoveWire.description: This method is called when a wire is removed from one of the terminals

removeFocus.description: Remove the class that shows the container as "focused"

redrawAllTerminals.description: Redraw all the wires connected to the terminals of this container

remove.description: Remove this container from the dom

onMouseDown.description: Called when the user made a mouse down on the container and sets the focus to this container (only if within a Layer)

addTerminal.description: Instanciate the terminal from the class pointer "xtype" (default WireIt.Terminal)

getConfig.description: Return the config of this container.

onResize.description:
Function called when the container is being resized.
It doesn't do anything, so please override it.

params.name: event
params.description: The eventAddWire event fired by the terminal

params.name: args
params.description: This array contains a single element args[0] which is the added Wire instance

onAddWire.description: This method is called when a wire is added to one of the terminals

layer.description: the WireIt.Layer object that schould contain this container

wires.description: List of all the wires connected to this container terminals

options.description:
Main options object
  • terminals: list of the terminals configuration
  • draggable: boolean that enables drag'n drop on this container (default: true)
  • className: CSS class name for the container element (default 'WireIt-Container')
  • position: initial position of the container
  • ddHandle: (only if draggable) boolean indicating we use a handle for drag'n drop (default true)
  • ddHandleClassName: CSS class name for the drag'n drop handle (default 'WireIt-Container-ddhandle')
  • resizable: boolean that makes the container resizable (default true)
  • resizeHandleClassName: CSS class name for the resize handle (default 'WireIt-Container-resizehandle')
  • width: initial width of the container (no default so it autoadjusts to the content)
  • height: initial height of the container (default 100)
  • close: display a button to close the container (default true)
  • closeButtonClassName: CSS class name for the close button (default "WireIt-Container-closebutton")
  • title: text that will appear in the module header
  • icon: image url to be displayed in the module header
  • preventSelfWiring: option to prevent connections between terminals of this same container (default true)

WireIt.Container.description: Visual module that contains terminals. The wires are updated when the module is dragged around.

WireIt.WiringEditor.name: WireIt.WiringEditor

constructors.description: The WiringEditor class provides a full page interface

render.description: Add the rendering of the layer

renderModulesAccordion.description: render the modules accordion in the left panel

addModule.description: add a module at the given pos

addModuleToList.description: Add a module definition to the left list

getValue.description: This method return a wiring within the given vocabulary described by the modules list

inputFilterTimer.description:
Method called from each keyup on the search filter in load panel.
The real filtering occurs only after 500ms so that the filter process isn't called too often

buildModulesList.description: Build the left menu on the left

modulesByName.description: Hash object to reference module definitions by their name

WireIt.WiringEditor.description: The WiringEditor class provides a full page interface

WireIt.Layer.name: WireIt.Layer

constructors.description: A layer encapsulate a bunch of containers and wires

eventAddContainer.description:
Event that is fired when a container is added
You can register this event with myTerminal.eventAddContainer.subscribe(function(e,params) { var container=params[0];}, scope);

eventAddWire.description:
Event that is fired when a wire is added
You can register this event with myTerminal.eventAddWire.subscribe(function(e,params) { var wire=params[0];}, scope);

eventRemoveWire.description:
Event that is fired when a wire is removed
You can register this event with myTerminal.eventRemoveWire.subscribe(function(e,params) { var wire=params[0];}, scope);

eventContainerDragged.description:
Event that is fired when a container has been moved
You can register this event with myTerminal.eventContainerDragged.subscribe(function(e,params) { var container=params[0];}, scope);

eventContainerResized.description:
Event that is fired when a container has been resized
You can register this event with myTerminal.eventContainerResized.subscribe(function(e,params) { var container=params[0];}, scope);

eventChanged.description:
Event that is fired when the layer has been changed
You can register this event with myTerminal.eventChanged.subscribe(function(e,params) { }, scope);

eventRemoveContainer.description:
Event that is fired when a container is removed
You can register this event with myTerminal.eventRemoveContainer.subscribe(function(e,params) { var container=params[0];}, scope);

initWires.description: Create all the wires passed in the config

params.name: event
params.description: The eventRemoveWire event fired by the container

params.name: args
params.description: This array contains a single element args[0] which is the removed Wire instance

onRemoveWire.description: Update the wire list when a wire is removed

onWireMouseMove.description:
Handles mousemove events on any wire canvas
Note: we treat mouse events globally so that wires behind others can still receive the events

render.description: Create the dom of the layer and insert it into the parent element

return.description: Wire instance build from the xtype

params.name: wireConfig
params.description: Wire configuration object (see WireIt.Wire class for details)

addWire.description: Instanciate a wire given its "xtype" (default to WireIt.Wire)

return.description: Container instance build from the xtype

params.name: containerConfig
params.description: Container configuration object (see WireIt.Container class for details)

addContainer.description: Instanciate a container given its "xtype": WireIt.Container (default) or a subclass of it.

onWireClick.description:
Handles click on any wire canvas
Note: we treat mouse events globally so that wires behind others can still receive the events

_getMouseEvtPos.description: Returns a position relative to the layer from a mouse event

initContainers.description: Create all the containers passed as options

clear.description: Remove all the containers in this layer (and the associated terminals and wires)

params.name: event
params.description: The eventAddWire event fired by the container

params.name: args
params.description: This array contains a single element args[0] which is the added Wire instance

onAddWire.description: Update the wire list when any of the containers fired the eventAddWire

getWiring.description: Return an object that represent the state of the layer including the containers and the wires

wires.description: List of all the WireIt.Wire (or subclass) instances in this layer

options.description:
Configuration object of the layer
  • className: CSS class name for the layer element (default 'WireIt-Layer')
  • parentEl: DOM element that schould contain the layer (default document.body)
  • containers: array of container configuration objects
  • wires: array of wire configuration objects
  • layerMap: boolean
  • layerMapOptions: layer map options

containers.description: List of all the WireIt.Container (or subclass) instances in this layer

WireIt.Layer.description: A layer encapsulate a bunch of containers and wires

WireIt.Wire.name: WireIt.Wire

constructors.description: The wire widget that uses a canvas to render

eventMouseClick.description:
Event that is fired when a wire is clicked (on the wire, not the canvas)
You can register this event with myWire.eventWireClick.subscribe(function(e,params) { var wire = params[0], xy = params[1];}, scope);

eventMouseMove.description:
Event that is fired when the mouse moves inside the wire
You can register this event with myWire.eventMouseMove.subscribe(function(e,params) { var wire = params[0], xy = params[1];}, scope);

eventMouseOut.description:
Event that is fired when the mouse exits the wire
You can register this event with myWire.eventMouseOut.subscribe(function(e,params) { var wire = params[0], xy = params[1];}, scope);

eventMouseIn.description:
Event that is fired when the mouse enter the wire
You can register this event with myWire.eventMouseIn.subscribe(function(e,params) { var wire = params[0], xy = params[1];}, scope);

params.name: x
params.description: left position of the mouse (relative to the canvas)

params.name: y
params.description: top position of the mouse (relative to the canvas)

onWireIn.description:
When the mouse comes into the wire
Note: this will only work within a layer

return.description: terminal    the terminal that is NOT passed as argument

getOtherTerminal.description: This function returns terminal1 if the first argument is terminal2 and vice-versa

params.name: x
params.description: left position of the mouse (relative to the canvas)

params.name: y
params.description: top position of the mouse (relative to the canvas)

onWireClick.description:
When the mouse clicked on the wire
Note: this will only work within a layer

remove.description: Remove a Wire from the Dom

setOptions.description: Build options object and set default properties

params.name: x
params.description: left position of the mouse (relative to the canvas)

params.name: y
params.description: top position of the mouse (relative to the canvas)

onMouseMove.description:
Called by the Layer when the mouse moves over the canvas element.
Note: the event is not listened directly, to receive the event event if the wire is behind another wire

drawBezierArrows.description: Attempted bezier drawing method for arrows

params.name: x
params.description: left position of the mouse (relative to the canvas)

params.name: y
params.description: top position of the mouse (relative to the canvas)

onClick.description:
When the mouse clicked on the canvas
Note: this will only work within a layer

params.name: x
params.description: left position of the mouse (relative to the canvas)

params.name: y
params.description: top position of the mouse (relative to the canvas)

onWireOut.description:
When the mouse comes out of the wire
Note: this will only work within a layer

params.name: x
params.description: left position of the mouse (relative to the canvas)

params.name: y
params.description: top position of the mouse (relative to the canvas)

onWireMove.description:
When the mouse moves over a wire
Note: this will only work within a layer

redraw.description: Redraw the canvas (according to the drawingMethod option)

return.description: true if the wire is drawn at position (x,y) relative to the canvas element

wireDrawnAt.description: Determine if the wire is drawn at position (x,y) relative to the canvas element. This is used for mouse events.

parentEl.description: Reference to the parent dom element

options.description:
Wire styling, and properties:
  • className: CSS class name of the canvas element (default 'WireIt-Wire')
  • coeffMulDirection: Parameter for bezier style
  • cap: default 'round'
  • bordercap: default 'round'
  • width: Wire width (default to 3)
  • borderwidth: Border Width (default to 1)
  • color: Wire color (default to rgb(173, 216, 230) )
  • bordercolor: Border color (default to #0000ff )

WireIt.Wire.description: The wire widget that uses a canvas to render

WireIt.TerminalProxy.name: WireIt.TerminalProxy

constructors.description: This class is used for wire edition. It inherits from YAHOO.util.DDProxy and acts as a "temporary" Terminal.

createFrame.description:
Took this method from the YAHOO.util.DDProxy class
to overwrite the creation of the proxy Element with our custom size

fakeTerminal.description: Object that emulate a terminal which is following the mouse

termConfig.description:
Object containing the configuration object
  • type: 'type' of this terminal. If no "allowedTypes" is specified in the options, the terminal will only connect to the same type of terminal
  • allowedTypes: list of all the allowed types that we can connect to.
  • {Integer} terminalProxySize: size of the drag drop proxy element. default is 10 for "10px"

WireIt.TerminalProxy.description: This class is used for wire edition. It inherits from YAHOO.util.DDProxy and acts as a "temporary" Terminal.

WireIt.Terminal.name: WireIt.Terminal

params.name: parentEl
params.description: Element that will contain the terminal

constructors.description: Terminals represent the end points of the "wires"

eventRemoveWire.description:
Event that is fired when a wire is removed
You can register this event with myTerminal.eventRemoveWire.subscribe(function(e,params) { var wire=params[0];}, scope);

eventAddWire.description:
Event that is fired when a wire is added
You can register this event with myTerminal.eventAddWire.subscribe(function(e,params) { var wire=params[0];}, scope);

getXY.description:
This function is a temporary test. I added the border width while traversing the DOM and
I calculated the offset to center the wire in the terminal just after its creation

params.name: display
params.description: Show the invitation if true, hide it otherwise

setDropInvitation.description: Show or hide the drop invitation. (by adding/removing this.options.dropinviteClassName CSS class)

render.description: Render the DOM of the terminal

getConnectedTerminals.description: Returns a list of all the terminals connecter to this terminal through its wires.

remove.description: Remove the terminal from the DOM

redrawAllWires.description: Redraw all the wires connected to this terminal

addWire.description: Add a wire to this terminal.

el.description: DIV dom element that will display the Terminal

container.description: Container (optional). Parent container of this terminal

options.description:
Object that contains the terminal configuration:

  • name: terminal name
  • direction: direction vector of the wires when connected to this terminal (default [0,1])
  • fakeDirection: direction vector of the "editing" wire when it started from this terminal (default to -direction)
  • editable: boolean that makes the terminal editable (default to true)
  • nMaxWires: maximum number of wires for this terminal (default to Infinity)
  • offsetPosition: offset position from the parentEl position. Can be an array [top,left] or an object {left: 100, bottom: 20} or {right: 10, top: 5} etc... (default to [0,0])
  • ddConfig: configuration of the WireIt.TerminalProxy object (only if editable)
  • alwaysSrc: alwaysSrc forces this terminal to be the src terminal in the wire config (default false, only if editable)
  • className: CSS class name of the terminal (default to "WireIt-Terminal")
  • connectedClassName: CSS class added to the terminal when it is connected (default to "WireIt-Terminal-connected")
  • dropinviteClassName: CSS class added for drop invitation (default to "WireIt-Terminal-dropinvite")

WireIt.Terminal.description: Terminals represent the end points of the "wires"

compact.description: compact replace Array.compact for cases where it isn't available
